Description: Fragment of perhaps neck of pottery closed vessel; inside has heavy wheel-marks; outside, uncertain object in upper register (bird?) and a sequence of pattern bands below - 'butterfly', triglyphs, rope pattern, and perhaps triangles.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 238, no. 246)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.71)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4799 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
